t: Jeremiah 49
A Message About Ammon
Concerning*p the Ammonites: This*p is what the Lord*s says: “Has*pn Israel no sons? Has*ld Israel no heir? Why*ln then has Molek taken possession of Gad? Why*ld do his people live in its towns?

But*ln the days are coming,” declares*ld the Lord,*s “when*ln I will sound the battle cry against*ld Rabbah of the Ammonites; it*ln will become a mound of ruins, and*ld its surrounding villages will be set on fire. Then*ln Israel will drive out those*ld who drove her out,” says*ld the Lord.*s

“Wail,*pn Heshbon, for Ai is destroyed! Cry*ld out, you inhabitants of Rabbah! Put*ln on sackcloth and mourn; rush*ld here and there inside the walls, for*ln Molek will go into exile, together*ld with his priests and officials.
Why*ln do you boast of your valleys, boast*ld of your valleys so fruitful? Unfaithful*ln Daughter Ammon, you*ld trust in your riches and say, ‘Who*ld will attack me?’
I*ln will bring terror on you from*ld all those around you,” declares*ld the Lord, the Lord*s Almighty. “Every*pn one of you will be driven away, and*ld no one will gather the fugitives.
“Yet*pn afterward, I will restore the fortunes of the Ammonites,” declares*ld the Lord.*s
A Message About Edom
Concerning*p Edom: This*p is what the Lord*s Almighty says: “Is*pn there no longer wisdom in Teman? Has*ld counsel perished from the prudent? Has*ld their wisdom decayed?
Turn*ln and flee, hide in deep caves, you*ld who live in Dedan, for*ln I will bring disaster on Esau at*ld the time when I punish him.
If*ln grape pickers came to you, would*ld they not leave a few grapes? If*ln thieves came during the night, would*ld they not steal only as much as they wanted?

But*ln I will strip Esau bare; I*ld will uncover his hiding places, so*ld that he cannot conceal himself. His*ln armed men are destroyed, also*ld his allies and neighbors, so*ld there is no one to say,
‘Leave*ln your fatherless children; I will keep them alive. Your*ld widows too can depend on me.’ ”
This*p is what the Lord*s says: “If those who do not deserve to drink the cup must drink it, why should you go unpunished? You will not go unpunished, but must drink it.
I swear by myself,” declares the Lord,*s “that Bozrah will become a ruin and a curse, an object of horror and reproach; and all its towns will be in ruins forever.”
I*pn have heard a message from the Lord;*s an*ld envoy was sent to the nations to say, “Assemble*ln yourselves to attack it! Rise*ld up for battle!”
“Now*pn I will make you small among the nations, despised*ld by mankind.

The*ln terror you inspire and*ld the pride of your heart have deceived you, you*ln who live in the clefts of the rocks, who*ld occupy the heights of the hill. Though*ln you build your nest as high as the eagle’s, from*ld there I will bring you down,” declares*ld the Lord.*s
“Edom*pn will become an object of horror; all*ld who pass by will be appalled and will scoff because*ld of all its wounds.
As*ln Sodom and Gomorrah were overthrown, along*ld with their neighboring towns,” says*ld the Lord,*s “so*pn no one will live there; no*ld people will dwell in it.

“Like*pn a lion coming up from Jordan’s thickets to*ld a rich pastureland, I*ln will chase Edom from its land in an instant. Who*ld is the chosen one I will appoint for this? Who*ln is like me and who can challenge me? And*ld what shepherd can stand against me?”

Therefore,*pn hear what the Lord*s has planned against Edom, what*ld he has purposed against those who live in Teman: The*ln young of the flock will be dragged away; their*ld pasture will be appalled at their fate.
At*ln the sound of their fall the earth will tremble; their*ld cry will resound to the Red Sea.
Look!*ln An eagle will soar and swoop down, spreading*ld its wings over Bozrah. In*ln that day the hearts of Edom’s warriors will*ld be like the heart of a woman in labor.
A Message About Damascus
Concerning*p Damascus: “Hamath*pn and Arpad are dismayed, for*ld they have heard bad news. They*ln are disheartened, troubled*ld like the restless sea.
Damascus*ln has become feeble, she*ld has turned to flee and*ld panic has gripped her; anguish*ln and pain have seized her, pain*ld like that of a woman in labor.
Why*ln has the city of renown not been abandoned, the*ld town in which I delight?
Surely,*ln her young men will fall in the streets; all*ld her soldiers will be silenced in that day,” declares*ld the Lord*s Almighty.
“I*pn will set fire to the walls of Damascus; it*ld will consume the fortresses of Ben-Hadad.”
A Message About Kedar and Hazor
Concerning*p Kedar and the kingdoms of Hazor, which Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon attacked: This*p is what the Lord*s says: “Arise,*pn and attack Kedar and*ld destroy the people of the East.
Their*ln tents and their flocks will be taken; their*ld shelters will be carried off with*ld all their goods and camels. People*ln will shout to them, ‘Terror*ld on every side!’
“Flee*pn quickly away! Stay*ld in deep caves, you who live in Hazor,” declares*ld the Lord.*s “Nebuchadnezzar*pn king of Babylon has plotted against you; he*ld has devised a plan against you.
“Arise*pn and attack a nation at ease, which*ld lives in confidence,” declares*ld the Lord,*s “a*pn nation that has neither gates nor bars; its*ld people live far from danger.

Their*ln camels will become plunder, and*ld their large herds will be spoils of war. I*ln will scatter to the winds those who are in distant places and*ld will bring disaster on them from every side,” declares*ld the Lord.*s
“Hazor*pn will become a haunt of jackals, a*ld desolate place forever. No*ln one will live there; no*ld people will dwell in it.”
A Message About Elam
This*p is the word of the Lord*s that came to Jeremiah the prophet concerning Elam, early in the reign of Zedekiah king of Judah:
This*p is what the Lord*s Almighty says: “See,*pn I will break the bow of Elam, the*ld mainstay of their might.
I*ln will bring against Elam the four winds from*ld the four quarters of heaven; I*ln will scatter them to the four winds, and*ld there will not be a nation where*ld Elam’s exiles do not go.

I*ln will shatter Elam before their foes, before*ld those who want to kill them; I*ln will bring disaster on them, even*ld my fierce anger,” declares*ld the Lord.*s “I*pn will pursue them with the sword until*ld I have made an end of them.
I*ln will set my throne in Elam and*ld destroy her king and officials,” declares*ld the Lord.*s
“Yet*pn I will restore the fortunes of Elam in*ld days to come,” declares*ld the Lord.*s
